result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence G. Gilbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (7/6/15) or request a payment plant through the Clerk of Courts office within said time.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge, if not already done.

Defendant to comply and follow all rules of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence G. Gilbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(2:57) Defendant, Lawrence G. Gilbert in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. heard on status - Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; victim rights complied with; Court reviews right to counsel; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to DC; parties stip. to facts; Court finds PC and finds plea and waiver made FV&K and finds Def. guilty of DC; victim declines to make statement; State heard; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. to report to P&P by 4pm on Tues.

** W/H - 12 mo PO
- follow all rules of PO
- $243 CC
- $200 DNA surcharge
- Provide DNA sample (Def. says he already has)
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Lawrence G. Gilbert in court, in custody via video from DCJ with attorney Greg E. Vollan (not eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters not guilty plea on defendant's behalf. RD & JT set. Court sets $350 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
